posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.61 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes.

Complete list of new commits since 7.60.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.60.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.60 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.61.0 (160000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

30 new commits since 7.60.2:

Show commits

  • Fix blocking bugs for internal link and sync testing. [1]

  • Fix ANR when trying to load a message composed of 10,000 random emoji. [2]

  • Fix ANR when trying to load a message composed of 10,000 random emoji. [3]

  • Require ACI for ReadMessage sender field. [4]

  • Add helper to catch/wrap exceptions that originate inside runWithUnauthChatConnection. [5]

  • New Conversation v2 - Fix find by username/phone options disappearing after rotation. [6]

  • Utilize snapshotFlow to fix insets. [7]

  • Fix sticker management top app bar menu padding. [8]

  • Remove redundant IdentityKeyUtil helper. [9]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.84.0 [10]

  • Update manifest to reflect constrained satellite network support. [11]

  • Add default style for dropdown menu item text. [12]

  • Utilize proper theme color. [13]

  • Fix duplicate messages during backup import causing unique constraint failure bug. [14]

  • Add polls to backups. [15]

  • Implement skip restore on the iOS to android failure screen. [16]

  • Fix improper media selection after deletion. [17]

  • Fix BioRecipientState if recipient does not have an e164. [18]

  • Utilize pointerIndex instead of a pointerId for motion events. [19]

    Fixes #14290

  • Fix automated tests for message backups checkout flow. [20]

  • Fix inline search display on landscape orientations. [21]

  • New conversation v2 - Add support for find by username/phone/contacts and group creation. [22]

  • Fix set archive transfer state race for duplicate attachments. [23]

  • Enable link device UX for nightly builds. [24]

  • Filter attachments except for LONG_TEXT when receiving an EditMessage. [25]

  • Fix NoSuchMessageException when loading stories. [26]

  • Add proper selection state support to Chats and Calls tabs. [27]

  • Fix flickering footer when inlining causes 1-2px change in width. [28]

  • Update translations and other static files. [29]

  • Bump version to 7.61.0 [30]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.60.2…v7.61.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

0 languages changed since 7.60.2:

No localization changes found

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked: Are there any features we should focus on testing for this release? Or anything in general we should pay more attention to? Thanks!

posts.name: Julio Nahum
posts.cooked:
This bug with Stories continues to occur in this version. When uploading a video longer than 30 seconds, according to Signal, the video will be trimmed into sections every 30 seconds. When uploaded, only the first 30 seconds are uploaded. The entire video never uploads. Here’s the debug log:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.61.0/1cbcb1c2abda7038827e3577d6427453f9830ef11578f9b6a7d5beb96888554c

But when uploading the same story, but before uploading, you trim the video by 1 second, if the entire story is uploaded. The two parts cut by Signal are uploaded correctly when modified by trimming the video by 1 second, before uploading. This bug has been around for a long time and is very annoying for everyone. I hope they follow up on it. Here’s the second debug log:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.61.0/c58afeb2b3b791575c955eb1151f9918cb374160e53d4f52cc468b82c598a424

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked: Why since august every release on github says “We sped up the performance of scrolling in long chats. If you are in a big gardening group, now bloom scrolling is also vroom scrolling.”

Unfortunately still having the crash after restoring a backup not sure if anything in this update was meant to fix it though. Either way here’s a debug log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.61.0/08ea711d2eb4c3f2f729d4ce30d07bdfdaacd7308710dd8046247e2a5d6a3000

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.61.0/02a81dbf18cd3b792561567699e0d5a8aa2a3f35b1fe057b20135bc54ffc33f7

1760562548473

Someone posted a bunch of stories with text, some of them long enough for view more to appear

For 2/3 I could click view more and it worked

For the last one it didn’t expand anything and I was blocked from reading the rest of the text

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Are there any features we should focus on testing for this release? Or anything in general we should pay more attention to? Thanks!

Multiple backup fixes and prep for large screen support which isn’t enabled. So not a whole lot unfortunately.

JulioNahum:

This bug has been around for a long time and is very annoying for everyone. I hope they follow up on it.

We’re still tracking it. Bumped it and added your recent report.

Gunter:

Unfortunately still having the crash after restoring a backup not sure if anything in this update was meant to fix it though.

Dang. Was really hoping this would fix it for you. Looks like you’ve found a new and different and exiting bug. We’ll look into it.

skmedix:

Why since august every release on github says

Reached out for new notes, we’ll see.

cody-signal:

Reached out for new notes, we’ll see.

The phrase “phone taking a tumble and getting back up to speed with a Signal Secure Backup” popped into my head.

Just an idea for new release notes. I feel like the community and developers here could come up with something much better

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
not sure when exactly this was introduced since i only just noticed it, and also not sure if this is an RTL thing, but stickers look really weird when the sender has a long nickname

signal-2025-10-16-211600719×684 57.6 KB

with a normal message it looks fine

signal-2025-10-16-211600_003718×145 11.4 KB

but something about that large empty space before the timestamp looks wrong

signal-2025-10-16-211600_002718×491 39.1 KB

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
Obtainium is telling me there’s an update to 7.60.3, while I have 7.61.1 installed…
It won’t install though…

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Do you have the pre-release tag enabled?

I have it enabled but I still can’t see the updates

Screenshot_20251017-181211864×1939 143 KB

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Gunter:

Unfortunately still had the crash when restoring a backup it did take a little longer to crash this time so maybe that’s progress?

Nah, still haven’t figured out your new issue yet.

ClauZ:

Obtainium is telling me there’s an update to 7.60.3, while I have 7.61.1

We had to do a prod hotifx for 60.3 but then later pushed 7.61.2. All of that looks available on GH so sounds like an Obtainium issue.

This issue I noticed in the previous release is still present in 7.61.2.

Logs
